isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 2000, 4000, 8000 - POWER DISTRIBUTION AND GROUND SYSTEM - OPERATION

svcproc.title: 12 Volt Power Distribution (Battery)
svcproc.para: Power is supplied from the vehicle batteries to the cranking motor solenoid "B" terminal over a 2/0, 3/0, 4/0 red cable depending on engine and model. From the "B" terminal, power is fed to Cummins engine controls over circuits 97 and 97A. With hydraulic brakes, power from the "B" terminal is fed to the hydraulic brake relay through fusible link 90-FL and circuit 90. Power is also fed through fusible link 14FL/14 to the starting motor mag switch and circuit 14 to the (J1) junction block on all but International engines. On vehicles with International engines, power is fed through fusible link 14FL/14 to connector (1CF), then through circuit 14 to junction block (J1). Junction block (J1) supplies power to the key switch (24) on circuit 15 and to the power distribution center on circuits 14R, 14P, and 14S. These circuits supply power distribution center circuits 14A, 14B, 14C, 14D, 14E, 14F, 14G, 14H, 14J, 14L, 14N, and 14T. (See individual circuits for continuation of circuitry.)
